DataElement.preferredName: Gynecologic Malignant Neoplasm Parametrium Left Involvement Ind-4
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable related to presence of malignant atypical neoplastic cells in the connective tissue of the floor of the pelvic cavity associated with tumor in the female reproductive organs on the left side of body.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gynecologic Malignant Neoplasm Parametrium Left Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to presence of malignant atypical neoplastic cells in the connective tissue of the floor of the pelvic cavity associated with tumor in the female reproductive organs on the left side of body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to or practicing gynecology; pertaining to the health issues of women.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to or practicing gynecology; pertaining to the health issues of women.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The connective tissue of the pelvic floor extending from the fibrous subserous coat of the supracervical portion of the uterus laterally between the layers of the broad ligament. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: The subserous connective tissue of the pelvic floor of the supracervical portion of the uterus. The parametrium extends laterally between the layers of the broad ligament.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.
